melt easy feature in RTS custom for SQL
Server please check out upcoming videos
to learn more
here is the agenda for this video I will
start with a quick overview of RTS
custom for SQL Server just in case you
are new to RDL custom then I'll go over

Amazon RB is custom is a managed
database service which automates
database Administration and operation
tasks at the same time it gives you the
option to customize your operating
system and the database environment
based on your needs RTS custom meets the
requirement of legacy and packaged
application since you can install a
third-party driver or any kind of
specialized software directly on the
host with a full access to the host and
the database environment you can now
migrate your SQL Server databases to a
managed database service and you can
enable features that are currently not
supported on Amazon RDS for SQL Server
finally with the newly released bring
your own media feature you now have the
ability to choose between the license
included RDS custom instance or you can
bring your own media to utilize your
existing SQL Server licenses
previously High variability was a shared
responsibility which means customers
will have to set up multi-azi using two
Standalone RDS custom instances
configured with always on availability
group
however with the multi-nc feature just
added last month customers can now
deploy their critical workloads to RDS
custom in a multi-az deployment multi is
a synchronously replicates your data to
a separate infrastructure in a second
availability Zone the configuration is
continuously monitored and failover
happens automatically because we are
replicating a storage layer the solution
Works seamlessly in all supporter
Editions
for workloads that require a high degree
of availability
RDS custom melt easy creates a second
instance with exact same ec2 instance
type and EBS volumes configured in
another available season it then creates
and set up a replication maintaining a
copy of your data in the secondary Zone
assuming the application that is
connecting to the database instance is
also configured to run in multiple
availability zones if the database
compute failed or the primary database
crashes are these custom automation
takes care of getting things back up and
running for you from the other
availability Zone the fillover usually
takes under 30 seconds but sometimes it
could take up to 2 minutes the
application then re-establishes the
connection to the new primary instance
using the same endpoint RDS customs and
replaces the secondary node and
re-establishes the replication between
the primary and the new secondary
instance let's look under the hood how
this works are these custom uses
synchronous physical block level storage
application to ensure that the secondary
always had the exact replica of the
primary data when SQL Server writes
through disk on a single easy deployment
it waits for the storage system to
acknowledge the right before it responds
back to the session that the changes
have been made durable with multi-azi
the same thing happens except the
storage layer transparently replicate
the changes to the secondary instance
and only acknowledges the right after it
has been sent to the storage and
acknowledged on both sides again right
on multig ensures the right occurs in
two different volumes the data is first
written to the EVS volume on the primary
it is then sent to the secondary once
written on the secondary the secondary
sense and knowledge driven to the
primary then the transaction is
completed and committed the secondary
does not host a running database
instance so you cannot connect to it for
read scaling or any other purposes it is
purely a standby now let's take a look
